page.title: 03Gravenhurst introduction
page.content: There is a small Post Office and Stores which sells bread, groceries and newspapers. It has a delivery service for papers employing three paper boys and girls. A Post Lady sorts the mail and delivers it every morning (excluding Sunday).The Post Office is run by the owner who works full-time with the help of three part-time lady assistants. The village has a Primary School with 28 children on roll aged from 5-9years, after which they transfer to Middle School in Shefford.a small Village Hall is available for hire.this is used by the Womens Institute monthly and the Darby and Joan fortnightly. It is also available for private functions e.g. wedding receptions, disco's etc. The majority of people living here have to travel out of the village to work.
